children.subject: Also saw this as well, didn't seem like the usual guy who comes in and does maintenance, and hearing their voices it seemed like they were discussing coursework. Note also seemed like the exact note from one of the lab computers that was actually "down for maintenance". Not saying for sure the lab wasn't actually down, but I agree with OP that it seems fishy. Weird that they needed the whole lab since 283 is right next door and they could get a lot of privacy (if they needed that).

history.content:
Hey there- first of all, can you please email me the photo? svannostrand@eecs.berkeley.edu. In the email, please let me know when this event occurred.

Second, I received the following from instructional support: 

Students should contact my group (inst@eecs.berkeley.edu, 333 Soda) about the Soda labs in general, but if there is an immediate safety or security issue they should go to the CS Office (387 Soda) or request emergency help (we have a link called "What if you are threatened in a lab?" on our WEB site, http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/.)

We post signs saying when the lab is reserved; the signs have our group name and address on them.  People must get approval from Michael-David and me to reserve the Soda labs (271, 273, 275, 277, 330, 349 Soda).

Hey there- first of all, can you please email me the photo? svannostrand@eecs

Second, I received the following from instructional support: 

Students should contact my group (inst@eecs.berkeley.edu, 333 Soda) about the Soda labs in general, but if there is an immediate safety or security issue they should go to the CS Office (387 Soda) or request emergency help (we have a link called "What if you are threatened in a lab?" on our WEB site, http://inst.eecs.berkeley.edu/.)

We post signs saying when the lab is reserved; the signs have our group name and address on them.  People must get approval from Michael-David and me to reserve the Soda labs (271, 273, 275, 277, 330, 349 Soda).

I don't really know what to say, there were two dudes using lab 277 in Soda this morning who were writing using cyrillic on the board obviously doing coursework. When I came in they promptly informed me that the lab was "closed for maintenance", and that I had to get out. After this, they removed the door stop taped a note on the door which said that the lab was "down for maintenance". 

Is this real life? I snapped a (bad) picture of one of them through the window, but the other guy was sitting behind a row of computers so I couldn't quite see his face. Obviously I don't want my name to be public so if someone in charge wants to see the pictures send me an email.

Edit: After they left, they took their "down for maintainance" sign down.
history.subject: Imposters hogging lab 277?
